text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
comm with how to make your own herb salt
this is a fantastic holiday gift idea
whether you can't think of what to get
that certain person or you don't have a
lot of cash
alright so this stuff's so easy to make
very cool makes a great gift for any
foodie also makes a great little extra
stocking stuffer so what we're gonna do
is we're going to take some fresh herbs
I'm using rosemary and lemon thyme I
have the advantage of having an herb
garden which you know you should really
have but if you don't just get some at
the supermarket we're going to watch
those herbs really well all right we're
going to pick them and we're going to
dry them really well so we don't have to
chop them here because they're all going
to get processed with the salt but we do
want it really dry we don't want to put
wet stuff with salt so the first step
here is to grind this in a food
processor with coarse sea salt alright
this is too coarse to eat as is but this
larger size is actually going to help us
pulverize all that herb and then we're
going to mix it with salt in the second
step so I'm going to put about 1/2 cup
pack of fresh herb in my food processor
with a 1/2 cup of the coarse sea salt
and we're going to pulse on and off on
and off on and off let it run for a
second or two turn it off
until it looks like that all right so
once it looks like that which is really
really beautiful as you can see all that
coarse salt is now basically the same
size as regular sea salt and to that
we're simply going to add a cup of
regular sea salt or kosher salt
you want something flaky something has a
nice you know fairly large crystal give
that a couple pulses on and off and
you're done how easy is that fresh herb
salt I'm going to pour it out into a
baking dish to let it dry out a little
bit now those herbs were dry but they
still have moisture in them so what I
like to do is leave this out on a tray
like this or a pan for maybe two three
hours just out in the open and that will
help evaporate a little bit of that
moisture so this is called a finishing
salt mean it's sprinkled on to cooked
food once it's done things like french
fries set of regular salt awesome with
this just so many so many delicious
things you can do with it alright so
once that's dried a little bit we are
going to simply jar it up I just use
these little may
and jars all right so there you go very
simple very easy and not even something
you can really buy in a store I mean
there's you know herb mixes and salt
rubs and things like that but this is
homemade extra special and the person
you get it for I think will appreciate
it more there's something you just
grabbed off the shelf that you know Bed
Bath & Beyond a day before Christmas all
right if you want to get extra extra
fancy you can get some of this craft
paper and you can make your own
customized labels there you can see
Uncle John's famous fresh herb salt use
on or with food you know as opposed to
de-icing your steps anyway hope you give
it a try all the ingredients are on the
site as usual and as always enjoy
